headline: Tesla’s profit engine is sputtering. Elon Musk has bet its future on a promise he’s far from delivering
summary: Tesla’s robotaxi service has been mostly hypothetical so far, but it’s certainly taking the company’s shareholders for a real ride.

content.title: Tesla’s profit engine is sputtering. Elon Musk has bet its future on a promise he’s far from delivering
content.summary: Tesla’s robotaxi service has been mostly hypothetical so far, but it’s certainly taking the company’s shareholders for a real ride.

thumbnail.caption: A Tesla robotaxi moves through Austin, Texas, traffic on its first day of operations in June. But the service is not fully autonomous and still has "safety monitors" from the company riding in the car with passengers. - Eric Gay/AP

headline: This Week In Energy Transition - Renewable Energy Gains Boost with Major $300 Million Investment
summary: Crayhill Capital Management and Monarch Private Capital have announced a strategic joint venture to invest $300 million in renewable energy projects, focusing on tax credit transfer partnerships. The Monarch JVT Funding initiative aims to streamline hybrid preferred tax equity investments in utility-scale solar, battery storage, and distributed generation projects. This collaboration seeks to optimize tax credit value for renewable energy developers while reducing transfer complexities...

headline: He Gave His Wife Full Access To Their Retirement. At 80, She Cheated And Lost $750K To Scammers. 'She Thinks That She's Saner Than All Of Us'
summary: A heartbreaking call to “The Ramsey Show” shed light on the financial chaos that can unfold when cognitive decline, online scams and decades of marital denial collide. Stacey, a caller from Atlanta, shared the story of her in-laws, both in their 80s. The couple had been married for 60 years and built a multimillion-dollar nest egg. headline: Microsoft to pay more for power, US Bancorp's $1B deal for BTIG
summary: Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Microsoft's (MSFT) goals to offset data center impact on US consumers' electricity bills, regional bank US Bancorp's (USB) reaching a $1 billion deal to acquire BTIG, and Tesla stock (TSLA) searching for direction in Tuesday's session after Wolfe Research analyst Emmanuel Rosner wrote that he remains "tactically constructive" on the EV maker. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Microsoft to pay more for power, US Bancorp's $1B deal for BTIG

Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Microsoft's (MSFT) goals to offset data center impact on US consumers' electricity bills, regional bank US Bancorp's (USB) reaching a $1 billion deal to acquire BTIG, and Tesla stock (TSLA) searching for direction in Tuesday's session after Wolfe Research analyst Emmanuel Rosner wrote that he remains "tactically constructive" on the EV maker.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Elon Musk Responds To xAI Retention Criticism, Says Company's  'Regretted Departures' Are Minimal: 'We Are Accelerating Faster Than...'
summary: Billionaire Elon Musk has responded to criticism of his artificial intelligence company xAI's poor talent retention, defending the company's operations. 50% Attrition Rate At xAI On Saturday, user Varunram Ganesh took to the social media platform X, sharing a post with a screenshot of an employee announcing their departure from xAI after six months of working with the AI company. headline: Stream Realty Partners Announces Sale of Three-Building Empire West Portfolio in Houston's West Submarket
summary: Stream Realty Partners, a national commercial real estate firm offering an integrated platform of services, announces the sale of Empire West Buildings 1, 3, and 8, totaling 1,038,619 square feet, as well as a 16.6-acre outdoor storage yard. The complete Empire West development is an institutional-quality, Class A industrial portfolio totaling 3,969,811 square feet across 10 buildings, located in Houston's rapidly expanding West submarket.

content.title: Stream Realty Partners Announces Sale of Three-Building Empire West Portfolio in Houston's West Submarket
content.summary: Stream Realty Partners, a national commercial real estate firm offering an integrated platform of services, announces the sale of Empire West Buildings 1, 3, and 8, totaling 1,038,619 square feet, as well as a 16.6-acre outdoor storage yard. The complete Empire West development is an institutional-quality, Class A industrial portfolio totaling 3,969,811 square feet across 10 buildings, located in Houston's rapidly expanding West submarket.

headline: Strive, Inc. (Nasdaq: ASST) and Semler Scientific (Nasdaq: SMLR) Announce Shareholder Approval for Acquisition of Semler Scientific
summary: DALLAS, TX and CAMPBELL, CA, Jan. 13, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Strive, Inc. (“Strive”) announces Semler Scientific, Inc. (“Semler Scientific”) stockholders voted to approve being acquired by Strive. As part of the all-stock transaction, Strive will acquire Semler Scientific’s 5,048.1 Bitcoin. Strive also announces the purchase of 123 additional Bitcoin for its corporate treasury at an average price of $91,561 per Bitcoin, for a total purchase price of $11,264,000, inclusive of fees and expenses,

headline: President Trump to U.S. Car Makers: ‘Let China Come.’
summary: President Trump visited Detroit, Michigan, on Tuesday, in the heart of the American auto industry.  “Let China come in,” said Trump at one point, a statement that might raise eyebrows for American auto executives.  China has low-cost sources of parts and labor, and its  BYD  is now the largest seller of all-electric cars globally, topping  Tesla  for the first time in 2025.

content.title: President Trump to U.S. Car Makers: ‘Let China Come.’
content.summary: President Trump visited Detroit, Michigan, on Tuesday, in the heart of the American auto industry.  “Let China come in,” said Trump at one point, a statement that might raise eyebrows for American auto executives.  China has low-cost sources of parts and labor, and its  BYD  is now the largest seller of all-electric cars globally, topping  Tesla  for the first time in 2025.
